wikipedia_page.main: Francis Henry Blackburne Daniell (1845 – 10 February 1921) was an Anglo-Irish barrister and historian, known for his work on the Calendar of State Papers.

response: Browne married Alice Caroline, daughter of Francis Henry Blackburne Daniell in 1906, and had two sons. The judge Sir Patrick Browne was his son.
* Francis Henry Blackburne Daniell (1845 – 10 February 1921) was an Anglo-Irish barrister and historian

Patrick Browne was in Cambridge, the son of Edward Granville Browne, a leading Cambridge Orientalist, and of Alice Caroline Browne, daughter of the historian Francis Henry Blackburne Daniell. His grandfather was Sir Benjamin Chapman Browne, head of the shipbuilding and engineering firm R. & W. Hawthorn, Leslie and Company. His father died in 1924 and his mother died the following year.
